title: Zogre Flesh Eaters/Quick guide

properties.name: description
properties.value: Grish will give you two Super restore potions and three Cooked chompy birds.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Zogre Flesh Eaters/Quick guide
 This quick guide has an in-depth guide here.
It contains a more detailed description of dialogue, cutscenes, and storyline.

Details[edit | edit source]

Start point Begin by speaking to Grish located in Jiggig, which is west of the Gu'Tanoth and south of Castle Wars.
Official difficultyIntermediate
DescriptionRun for your lives...the zombie ogres are here for your flesh! An ogre ceremonial dance area, used to communicate with ancient ogrish ancestors, has been overrun with diseased undead ogres. How could something like this have happened? And what sort of rewards could an enterprising adventurer gain from exploring the tombs of such a place?
Official lengthShort
Requirements
  • Completion of the following quests:
    • Big Chompy Bird Hunting
    • Jungle Potion
  • You must be able to defeat a level 111 enemy.
  • 4 Smithing (boostable)
  • 8 Herblore (boostable)
  • 30 Ranged (not boostable)
Items required
  • 5 free inventory spaces are needed to receive items near the start of the quest
  • A comp ogre bow (not needed if using Crumble Undead in final battle) or:
    • Wolf bones
    • Achey logs (obtainable during quest)
    • Knife (obtainable during quest)
    • Axe of your Woodcutting level
    • Bow string
  • Brutal arrows (not needed if using Crumble Undead in final battle) or:
    • Achey logs
    • Knife (obtainable during quest)
    • Nails of your Smithing level
    • Hammer
    • Feathers (4 per 1 brutal arrow)
Recommended
  • 45 Combat level
  • 43 Prayer for protection prayers
  • 10+ Strength (otherwise it is very difficult to open the chest below the stairs in the north-west corner. Strength boosts are useful here)
  • 30 Fletching (boostable) (is needed if you want to create your own Comp ogre bow and 33 Fletching is needed to fletch Brutal arrows.)
  • Strength potion if your strength is low. Opening the ogre tomb seems to require strength and lowers your level each time you fail.
  • Vial of water, Rogue's purse and Snake weed if you choose to learn the technique that allows you to mix Relicym's balm (pretty much necessary if < 89 combat, unless you have sanfew serum).
  • A Sanfew serum would be helpful to prevent disease and restore stats. Relicym's balm is a cheap alternative to the Sanfew serum
  • Ava's accumulator to conserve arrows
  • Instead of a Super restore or two (obtained at start of quest), you can bring (Super) combat/ranged/magic potions and keep the Super restores for another day to save some money. You will become diseased, which reduces your stats randomly and can last a while.
  • A ring of dueling to teleport to Castle Wars and Ferox Enclave to restore your stats and cure disease with the pools.
  • A Yanille Teleport
Enemies to defeat
  • Slash Bash (level 111)
  • Zombie (level 39)

And what sort of rewards could an enterprising adventurer gain from exploring the tombs of such a place?","difficulty":"Intermediate","kills":"* [[Slash Bash]] ''(level 111)''\n* [[Zombie (Zogre Flesh Eaters)|Zombie]] ''(level 39)''","name":"Zogre Flesh Eaters/Quick guide","start":"Begin by speaking to [[Grish]] located in [[Jiggig]], which is west of the [[Gu'Tanoth]] and south of [[Castle Wars]].","length":"Short","items":"* 5 free inventory spaces are needed to receive items near the start of the quest\n* A [[comp ogre bow]] (not needed if using [[Crumble Undead]] in final battle) '''or''':\n** [[Wolf bones]]\n** [[Achey logs]] (obtainable during quest)\n** [[Knife]] (obtainable during quest)\n** [[Axe]] of your [[Woodcutting]] level\n** [[Bow string]]\n* [[Brutal arrows]] (not needed if using [[Crumble Undead]] in final battle) '''or''':\n** [[Achey logs]]\n** [[Knife]] (obtainable during quest)\n** [[Nails]] of your [[Smithing]] level\n** [[Hammer]]\n** [[Feather]]s (4 per 1 brutal arrow)"}

Walkthrough[edit | edit source]

Starting off[edit | edit source]

  • Speak to Grish located in Jiggig west of the Gu'Tanoth and south of Castle Wars (east of fairy ring bkp) and offer to help. ( 2•4•2•1)…
    2What do you mean sickies?
    4Can I help in any way?
    2Okay, I'll check things out and report back.
    1Yes, I'm really sure!

Grish will give you two Super restore potions and three Cooked chompy birds.

  • Speak to Ogre guard to the east, he will remove the barricade to gain access to the Zogre-infested area.
  • Climb over the crushed barricade and run east to a set of stairs going downwards, go down these stairs.

The cave[edit | edit source]

Note: You may now (or already have been) become diseased if under 89 combat and a Zogre or Skogre attacks you (level 44). Carry Super restore potions at all times. The disease lowers a random skill 10 levels every minute or so!

  • Run north-west to an area with a blackened floor, a short cut scene will begin.
  • Search the skeleton next to the Broken Lecturn. A Zombie will appear and attack, kill it to obtain the Ruined backpack.
  • Open the Ruined backpack to obtain a Dragon inn tankard, some rotten food and a knife.
  • Search the broken lecturn for the Torn page (make sure you keep this).
  • Attempt to search the coffin west of the Skeleton, and then use a knife on it.
  • Attempt to open coffin (may take a couple of tries), search the coffin for the Black prism.

Yanille[edit | edit source]

  • Go to the Dragon Inn in Yanille and use the tankard on the bartender. The Minigame Teleport to NMZ can take you here quickly.
  • Speak to Zavistic Rarve in the Wizards' Guild in Yanille (if you don't have the required level to enter, ring the bell out front). (( 1)…
    1I'm here about the sicks…err Zogres
    if you have started Hand in the Sand)

Incriminating Sithik[edit | edit source]

  • Speak to Sithik Ints in his bed in the upstairs bedroom in the guest house north of the Wizards' Guild ( 3)…
    3Do you mind if I look around?
  • Search the drawers, cupboard and wardrobe for Book of portraiture, Necromancy book, Papyrus, Charcoal and a Book of 'H.A.M'.
  • Read all three books.
  • Use all three books on Sithik.
  • Use Papyrus on Sithik.
  • Use portrait on Sithik.
    • Note: He must appreciate the "honesty" of the portrait, not the "truth". More papyrus can be found in the drawers.
    • Note: The portrait's examine text must say "A classic realist charcoal portrait of Sithik."
  • Go to the Dragon Inn in Yanille and use the Dragon Inn Tankard, then the portrait on the Bartender.

The Bartender will sign the portrait as an affidavit.

  • Speak to Zavistic Rarve while holding the Necromancy book, Book of 'H.A.M', the tankard and the signed portrait. ( 3)…
    3I have some items that I'd like you to look at.
    or ( 1•3)…
    1I'm here about the sicks…err Zogres}{Chat option
    3I have some items that I'd like you to look at.
    if you have started Hand in the Sand.

Zavistic Rarve will give you a Strange potion.

  • Use the Strange potion on the Cup of tea on top of Sithik's drawers.
  • Go downstairs and back upstairs.
  • Speak to Sithik, obtain answers to all three questions in order to make Relicym's balm and Brutal arrows ( 1•2•3•4)…
    1How do I remove the effects of the spell from the area?
    2How do I get rid of the undead ogres
    3How do I get rid of the disease
    4Sorry, I have to go.
    .

Relocating the ceremonial grounds[edit | edit source]

  • Return and speak to Grish ( 1)…
    1I found who's responsible for the Zogres being here.
    . He will give you an Ogre gate key to access the Ceremonial chamber.
  • Talk to Grish again "There must be an easier way to kill these Zogres" to learn how to equip Composite ogre bows ( 2)…
    2
    .
  • Prepare to fight Slash Bash (level 111). If you are using an comp ogre bow instead of Crumble Undead, follow the "optional" steps below.

Making an ogre composite bow (optional)[edit | edit source]

  • Chop an Achey Tree for logs.
  • Use a knife on the achey tree logs with wolf bones in your inventory, and select option 2 to create an unstrung comp bow.
  • String the bow with bow string to create the finished bow.

Making Relicym's balm (optional)[edit | edit source]

  • Either buy one from the Grand Exchange or make it yourself by adding Rogue's purse to a Vial of water and then add Snake weed. It is not needed for the quest but giving it to Uglug Nar will allow you to purchase Relicym's balm from his shop if needed in the future.

Making brutal arrows (optional)[edit | edit source]

Note: If you have access to the Grand Exchange, you can just buy the arrows and skip this section.

  • Cut down Achey Trees for Achey tree logs.
  • Fletch the logs with a knife into Ogre arrow shafts.
  • Add feathers to the shafts.
  • With a hammer in your inventory use nails on the Flighted ogre arrows.

Fighting Slash Bash[edit | edit source]

Note: Slash Bash uses Ranged and Melee, easiest method is to use Ranged from a safespot with Protect from Ranged prayer turned on. Alternatively, one may use the spell Crumble Undead if they prefer to use magic.

  • Head back down into Jiggig.
  • Travel west until you reach two sets of doors.
  • Go through both doors and go down the stairs.
  • Follow the chamber to the end and search the stand.
  • Kill Slash Bash and collect the Zogre bones and Ogre artefact that he drops.
  • Return and speak to Grish. ( 1)…
    1
    • You can now sell the Black prism to Zavistic Rarve for 2000 coins or Yanni Salika for 5000 coins, after the quest.

Congratulations! Quest Complete!

Rewards[edit | edit source]

  • 1 Quest point
  • 3 ourg bones
  • 2 zogre bones
  • 2,000 Fletching experience
  • 2,000 Ranged experience
  • 2,000 Herblore experience
  • Ability to make Relicym's balm
  • Ability to fletch comp ogre bows and brutal arrows
  • Ability to wear inoculation bracelets
  • Give a 2-, 3-, or 4-dose Relicym's balm to Uglug to gain access to ~ Uglug's stuffsies ~
